comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Calla Lundström Curman (1850-1935)--writer, editor, feminist, conservationist, wife of Carl Peter Curman (1833-1913), photographer and professor; their son Jon Sigurd Curman was an architectural historian: sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calla_Curman sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Peter_Curman sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jon_Sigurd_Curman

comment.author: 67894941@N00
comment._content: Vi har Calla Curman att tacka för bevarandet av Stångehuvud (Naturreservat) som annars skulle ha blivit stenbrott.

comment.author: 97449017@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sweden before 1945, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 35088462@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Women’s Work, and we'd love to have this added to the group! I've also started a thread Women in aprons, I've love to have you post there: www.flickr.com/groups/womenswork/discuss/72157623761408395/ To post a picture comment, put the photo link in brackets [ ]

comment.author: 67894941@N00
comment._content: Thanks to this remarkable woman (Calla Curman) we can today enjoy the beauty of the nature reserve "Stångehuvud". If it hadn´t been for Mrs Curman the whole place would have been a giant quarry.

comment.author: 35088462@N08
comment._content: Lygge :  It's great to know the history with the photos!  What a powerful woman!

comment.author: 63490235@N04
comment._content: how come the servants look so clean & her apron is dirty !!?  She must be one of those who still preferred to do the work mostly herself !!

comment.author: 67894941@N00
comment._content: Interesting observation :) You are probably right.
